alert.note: Alert for Acadia; Evangeline; Jefferson Davis; Lafayette; St. Landry; Vermilion (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 4:12PM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Lafayette, eastern Jefferson Davis, southwestern Evangeline, Acadia, northwestern Vermilion, northwestern St. Martin and southwestern St. Landry Parishes through 500 PM CDT... At 411 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Pine Island to near Branch. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lafayette, Crowley, Eunice, Jennings, Scott, Breaux Bridge, Rayne, Carencro, Church Point, Welsh, Lake Arthur, Basile, Iota, Gueydan, Elton, Arnaudville, Mermentau, Evangeline, Broussard and Sunset. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 55 and 119. Interstate 49 between mile markers 1 and 14. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for central, south central and southwestern Louisiana.

area.areaDesc: Acadia; Evangeline; Jefferson Davis; Lafayette; St. Landry; Vermilion
